subject: Cryptic Clues
msgSnippet: How best we can define and incorporate the functionalities of JUnit in a Rose Model ? Isn t it a bit less cryptic this time (hmmm !!!) -pankaj ... From: Jason
messageBody:
How best we can define and incorporate the functionalities of JUnit in a
Rose Model ?
Isn't it a bit less cryptic this time (hmmm !!!)

-pankaj

----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Rogers <jacaetev@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, October 19, 2001 2:31 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Rational Rose Model with JUnit3.7


> Pankaj,
>
> As usual (sorry...), your message is cryptic. Many of
> us have done work with UML, inheritance, and
> polymorphism -- but somehow, I don't think that is
> what you meant to ask. What is your question?
>
> -jason
>
> --- Pankaj Solanki <psolanki@...> wrote:
> > Hi All,
> >
> > I am working on development of Rational Rose Model
> > which integrates testing functionalities of test
> > class with the design class.
> >
> > For this purpose, I am extending my test class from
> > "TestBase" (which in turns extending "TestCase" in a
> > different package junit.framework). The class
> > TestBase implementing "TestClass" interface.
> >
> > If anybody has done any work, in this field, please
> > let me know, so I may be assured of following right
> > track.
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Pankaj
> >
> >
>
>
